history.text: What do you think about Jim Carrey as Bruce?
I think he played the role really well, and was quite funny.
Yea I thought the bruce character was pretty funny when he was complaining to God
Morgan Freeman is the perfect person to play God.
Yes he has just the right voice and persona to pull it off don't you agree?
Yeah, definitely. I don't know why so many of the ratings of the movie were kind of mediocre.
The ratings were a bit unfair, it's an underrated movie for sure.
I didn't remember that Jennifer Aniston was in Bruce Almighty.
I don't remember seeing her either
Was she really in it? Wait was she the girlfriend?
I think his girlfriend was Grace
I have no idea actually, I would have to rewatch it. It's been a long time since it came out, I can't even remember when I last saw it.
Did you like Jim Carrey in the news reporter role?
Oh I guess you're right about Bruce's girlfriend being Grace.
I did like him as a news reporter.
It was a good fit for him I think.
Did you laugh when he got turned down for the promotion?

He plays almost all his roles really well, even if the movie itself isn't great. It seems like that was a reoccurring criticism of his movies: that his acting was good but the movies themselves weren't always equal to the amount of comedic effort he put in.
I felt bad for his character honestly when he got turned down.
I agree with that he is pretty good even when using a relatively silly storyline like this movie. He was very believable in this role and did a great job
Did you like how he took to the role of being God?
I thought it was funny what he tried to do with the emails.
It was humorous, but I almost felt sympathy for all the characters around him who were being negatively affected by his random decisions that he made, as God, for his own benefit.
Do you think Evan should have been fired just because Bruce wanted his job?
I still thought those parts were pretty funny even though they were a bit tortured. I was amused by that also.
Which girl do you think was a better fit for him?
If Bruce ended up loving Grace enough to marry her, and God decided he was the man who would make her most happy, then I think they belonged together.
I like how Bruce ends up ultimately enjoying his job as a reporter more, and appreciating the things that he has instead of envying others
I think so too, plus I like the actress better
Yes it had a good message in that way, that was a nice touch. It was pretty believable for such a silly plot.
Exactly, a heartwarming ending is always nice. You like Jennifer Aniston better than Catherine Bell?
Yes I like Jennifer Aniston a lot better what about you?
I don't really know, actually. I never really thought about it. What do you think of the director, Tom Shadyac?
I don't really have an opinion of him but he did a good job I would have to say.
Same here. Bruce Almighty is such an iconic movie.
It is a pretty one of kind movie in a lot of ways.
What was your favorite part?
